other_tests.findings: Reduction of compound muscle action potential (CMAP) amplitude at the fibular neck, lower distal CMAP amplitude on the right side compared to the left; decreased SNAP amplitude of the right superficial fibular nerve (2 mV, reference value > 7 mV); normal motor tibial and sural sensory studies.

Spontaneous activity in the form of positive sharp waves and fibrillation potentials in the right tibialis anterior and right extensor digitorum brevis; motor unit recruitment was reduced; normal examination of the right tibialis posterior and medial gastrocnemius.

A lobulated cystic mass of approximately 2.5 cm located between the proximal tibia and the fibular neck, showing low to intermediate signal intensity on T1-weighted images and high signal intensity on T2-weighted images; demonstrated cystic appearance with peripheral enhancement after gadolinium administration.
Revealed proximal enlargement of the deep fibular nerve and removal of the ganglion cyst.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Postoperatively, significant improvement with only minor weakness of foot dorsiflexion remaining; condition stable without recurrence of symptoms after 1 year.
